conclusion: Analyze the behavior of ions in the velocity selector, magnetic analyzer, and deflection system.
In the velocity selector, electric field E and magnetic field B are perpendicular to each other and to the direction of motion of the ions.
For ions to pass through the velocity selector without being deflected, electric force must balance magnetic force: qE = qvB.
Solving for velocity v gives v = E/B.
In the magnetic analyzer, ions experience a magnetic force due to magnetic field B, causing them to move in circular paths.
Radius R of the circular path is found using qvB = mv^2/R.
Substituting v = E/B into the equation gives qE = mE^2/BR.
Ions selected by the magnetic analyzer have a constant charge-to-mass ratio, determining the radius R.
In the deflection system, ions are subjected to both electric field E and magnetic field B.
Electric field causes deflection in y-direction, magnetic field causes deflection in x-direction.
Deflection angles θ_E and θ_B are given by tan θ_E = qE/mBv and tan θ_B = qE/mBv.
Approximating tan θ ≈ θ gives θ_E ≈ qE/mB and θ_B ≈ qE/mB.
Total deflection angle θ is the sum of deflections: θ = θ_E + θ_B = 2qE/mB.
Final answer: magnitude of velocity v of ions after velocity selector is v = E/B.
Final answer: charge-to-mass ratio of ions selected by magnetic analyzer is q/m = EB/R.
